data.question: What is the title of the article?
data.answer: Interaction of Organoplatinum(II) Complexes with Monovalent Coinage-Metal Triflates

data.question: Who are the authors of the article?
What is the main focus of the study presented in the article?
data.answer: The study focuses on the interaction of organoplatinum(II) complexes with monovalent coinage-metal triflates.

data.question: What method was used to optimize the coordinates in the DFT calculations?
data.answer: The Gaussian03 package was used to optimize the coordinates in the DFT calculations.

data.question: What exchange-correlation functional was employed in the DFT calculations?
data.answer: The BP86 exchange-correlation functional was employed in the DFT calculations.

data.question: What basis set was used for transition metals in the DFT calculations?
data.answer: The Stuttgart/Dresden basis set and effective core potential were used for transition metals in the DFT calculations.

data.question: What type of interactions were studied between organoplatinum(II) complexes and coinage-metal triflates?
data.answer: The study investigated the electrostatic and orbital interactions between organoplatinum(II) complexes and coinage-metal triflates.

data.question: What was the purpose of using harmonic frequencies in the study?
data.answer: Harmonic frequencies were used to analyze the vibrational modes and stability of the complexes formed between organoplatinum(II) and coinage-metal triflates.

data.question: How did the authors confirm the formation of complexes in their study?
data.answer: The authors confirmed the formation of complexes through X-ray crystallography, UV-Vis spectroscopy, and ESI-MS analysis.

data.question: What was the significance of rotational constants in the DFT calculations?
data.answer: Rotational constants were significant in the DFT calculations for determining the rotational symmetry and molecular geometry of the complexes.
